intro: Grammitis melanosticta, commonly known as the black-stained fern, is a species of epiphytic fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 5 centimeters in length. The plant has a distinctive dark green to blackish coloration on its leaves, which gives it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or rocks in tropical and subtropical regions. Grammitis melanosticta is known for its intricate leaf structure and is often found in humid, low-light conditions in the understory of forests.
